column2: the ramen itself was not bad by any means. But it didn't amaze me. The broth was super rich and fatty
column4: but it was on the cusp of being too salty with a strong and distinct seaweed hint. The charsu was nice and flavorful with a nice tenderness to it. The noodle quality is where I knew I was eating Ramen in America vs Japan. Most higher quality noodles sort of suck up/cling the broth enhancing the flavor while not being overly mushy. Yet in fair honestly
column5: if I hadn't tried such good ramen in Japan
column6: I would not be opposed to saying how great this place is.
